body_html:
Could we also test advanced indexing with two integer tensors?

Something like

a = torch.rand(3, 4, 5, 6)
a[[0, 2], :, [3, 1]] = 1
# and
a[[0, 2], 1:3, [3, 1]] = 1

I believe the second case might require some special treatment because it has a mixture of indexing and advanced indexing
body_text:
Could we also test advanced indexing with two integer tensors?
Something like
a = torch.rand(3, 4, 5, 6)
a[[0, 2], :, [3, 1]] = 1
# and
a[[0, 2], 1:3, [3, 1]] = 1
I believe the second case might require some special treatment because it has a mixture of indexing and advanced indexing
body:
Could we also test advanced indexing with two integer tensors?

Something like
```python
a = torch.rand(3, 4, 5, 6)
a[[0, 2], :, [3, 1]] = 1
# and
a[[0, 2], 1:3, [3, 1]] = 1
```

I believe the second case might require some special treatment because it has a mixture of indexing and advanced indexing
